Description: Pottery bowl of Nile silt clay with flattened base, flaring sides and everted rim; exterior unslipped and loosely burnished. Interior is red slipped, well burnished and decorated with creamy-white pigment in cruciform arrangement of four panels filled with zig-zag lines creating a net-like pattern. The tondo has two lines crossing it. The edge of the interior rim is decorated with a zig-zag line. The paint has almost entirely faded, leaving mainly ghost impressions.
Curator's comments: Petrie’s White Cross line ware. The drawing publish by Brunton is not entirely accurate. The bowl was found in the grave of a woman and infant together with a bowl with 5 hippopotami modelled on the rim (see EA63408).
Condition: fair - cracked and restored, rim chipped
